titlestmt.titleproper: Commonwealth Fund records, United States Program, Accession 2007:077, SG 2
A Guide to the Commonwealth Fund records, United States Program, Accession 2007:077, SG 2 FA1131

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-09-02 19:52:51 -0400.

did.unittitle: Commonwealth Fund records, United States Program, Accession 2007:077, SG 2

physdesc.extent: 36 letter-sized document boxes, 1 legal document box.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accession digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) or audiovisual material (audio cassettes, VHS, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Commonwealth Fund was founded in 1918 by Mrs. Stephen (Anna) Harkness with the mandate that it should "do something for the welfare of mankind". Most of the Fund's grants throughout its existence have been in the broad field of health. Over the years, The Commonwealth Fund's work led to the development of the field of child guidance, contributed to the emergence of progressive public health departments in communities throughout the country, supported the construction of rural hospitals, and supported the development of new medical schools in the United States. Several facets of the Fund's continued interest in health are seen in this collection, including the availability of quality medical education and the Fund's concern for the "underserved" or vulnerable populations among us â€“ including women, children, minority populations, those in urban areas, the elderly, and the financially disadvantaged.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The material in this collection is divided into four series: Academic Health Centers, Medicare's Future, Quality of Care for Underserved Populations, and Program Officer Grant Files. The arrangement reflects the original order in which the material was received.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The material in this collection was received from the Treasurer's Office of The Commonwealth Fund. The individuals responsible for placing this material at the RAC were Diana Davenport and Tammy Ziccardi. The records were transferred to RAC in 2007 and officially accessioned as Accession 2007:077.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The material in this collection documents the work of The Commonwealth Fund's United States Program from the late 1990s through 2004/2005, although some material dates from as early as 1983 and as late as 2007. Grants comprise the bulk of the material.
